alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Madison (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 04 at 9:50PM CDT until November 05 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT SATURDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL AND MADISON COUNTIES... At 950 PM CDT, Although the heavy rainfall has ended, flooding of low lying areas could continue in a few locations this evening. HAZARD...Flooding from previous heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will could experience flooding include... Huntsville... St. Paul... Witter... Aurora... Boston... Pettigrew... Japton... Kingston... Saint Paul... Marble... Osage... Georgetown... Weathers... Dutton... Red Star... Brashears... Combs... Dryfork... Patrick... Delaney... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
